intro: Ruellia parvifolia, commonly known as the small-flower ruellia, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of the Americas. It is a herbaceous perennial that typically grows to a height of about 30–60 cm. The plant features opposite, lance-shaped leaves and produces clusters of small, tubular flowers in shades of blue or purple. Ruellia parvifolia is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens and as a ground cover. It prefers well-drained soil and partial to full sunlight, making it adaptable to a variety of growing conditions.
